Welcome to Contacts project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Health check endpoint to verify database connectivity.

Returns:

JSON message confirming service health.

Raises:

HTTPException if database is not configured or unreachable.

main.index(request: Request)¶

Serve the homepage with a simple template rendering.

async main.startup()¶

Startup event handler to initialize Redis connection and FastAPI rate limiter.

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

Middleware to block requests from banned user-agents.

Args:

request (Request): Incoming HTTP request. call_next (Callable): Function to process the request.

Returns:

Response or JSONResponse with 403 status if banned user-agent detected.

REST API crud Contact¶

async src.crud.contact.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Creates a new contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user creating the contact.

Raises:

ValueError – If a contact with the same email or phone already exists.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.crud.contact.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Deletes a contact by its ID for a given user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Returns:

The deleted contact if found and deleted, else None.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.crud.contact.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Retrieves a paginated list of all contacts for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user whose contacts are being retrieved.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.crud.contact.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID for a given user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

The contact if found, else None.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.crud.contact.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Searches for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search string.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user whose contacts are searched.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.crud.contact.upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Retrieves contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.crud.contact.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: AsyncSession, user_id: int)¶

Updates an existing contact’s details.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user who owns the contact.

Raises:

ValueError – If another contact with the same email or phone exists.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API crud Users¶

async src.crud.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Marks a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

async src.crud.users.create_user(body: UserCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates a new user in the database, including a Gravatar avatar.

Parameters:

  • body (UserCreate) – The user registration data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

User

async src.crud.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a user from the database by email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async src.crud.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → User | None¶

Retrieves a user from the database by their ID.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async src.crud.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • url (str | None) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.crud.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

REST API routers Auth¶

async src.routers.auth.confirm_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms a user’s email using the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If verification fails.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routers.auth.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

src.routers.auth.create_refresh_token(user_id: int) → str¶

Creates a new refresh token for the given user ID.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – The user’s ID.

Returns:

Encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async src.routers.auth.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → User | None¶

Retrieves a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The user’s email address.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

User object if found, else None.

Return type:

User | None

async src.routers.auth.login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticates a user and returns access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login form containing email and password.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If credentials are invalid.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens with type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routers.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes access and refresh tokens using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP Authorization credentials.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or expired.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

dict

async src.routers.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Sends a new email confirmation request.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email request data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks handler.

  • request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

Response message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routers.auth.signup(user_data: UserCreate, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Registers a new user and sends a confirmation email.

Parameters:

  • user_data (UserCreate) – The user’s registration data.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending email.

  • request (Request) – The incoming HTTP request.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already in use.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.routers.auth.track_email_open(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Tracks email open events by serving a tracking image.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username from the email link.

  • response (Response) – The response object.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

Returns:

PNG image file response.

Return type:

FileResponse

async src.routers.auth.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

REST API routers Contact¶

async src.routers.contact.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Contact creation data.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact with same email or phone already exists.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routers.contact.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact not found.

Returns:

No content.

Return type:

None

async src.routers.contact.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a paginated list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routers.contact.get_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact not found.

Contact details.

async src.routers.contact.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Extracts and validates the current user from the JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – JWT access token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or user does not exist.

Returns:

Authenticated User.

Return type:

User

async src.routers.contact.search_contacts(query: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Searches contacts by name or email.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – Search string (partial match).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Returns:

List of matched contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routers.contact.upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routers.contact.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates an existing contact’s data.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Contact update data.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

  • current_user (User) – Authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact not found or duplicate email/phone.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API routers Users¶

async src.routers.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Uploads and updates the current user’s avatar using Cloudinary.

The uploaded image is resized to 250x250 pixels and stored under a path based on the user’s email. After updating the avatar URL in the database, the user data is cached in Redis for quick retrieval.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload.

  • current_user (User) – The authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Async database session.

Returns:

The updated user profile.

Return type:

UserRead

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

The Auth class provides methods for user authentication, including password hashing, JWT token creation and validation, caching users in Redis, and retrieving the current user.

Attributes:

pwd_context (CryptContext): Password hashing context. SECRET_KEY (str): JWT secret key. ALGORITHM (str): JWT encryption algorithm. cache (redis.Redis): Redis connection for caching users. oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): OAuth2 scheme to extract token from the Authorization header.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(db=0,username=None,password=None,socket_timeout=None,encoding=utf-8,encoding_errors=strict,decode_responses=False,retry_on_error=[],retry=<redis.retry.Retry object>,health_check_interval=0,client_name=None,lib_name=redis-py,lib_version=6.4.0,redis_connect_func=None,credential_provider=None,protocol=2,host=localhost,port=6379,socket_connect_timeout=None,socket_keepalive=None,socket_keepalive_options=None)>)>)>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a JWT access token with the given data and expiration.

Parameters:

  • data – Data to encode in the token (e.g., {“sub”: user_id}).

  • expires_delta – Token lifetime in seconds (default 15 minutes).

Returns:

Encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create a JWT email confirmation token with a 1-day expiration.

Parameters:

data – Data to encode in the token.

Returns:

Encoded JWT email confirmation token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a JWT refresh token with the given data and expiration.

Parameters:

  • data – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta – Token lifetime in seconds (default 7 days).

Returns:

Encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode and validate the refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token – JWT refresh token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

Returns:

Email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve the current user based on the JWT access token.

Uses Redis cache to speed up access.

Parameters:

  • token – JWT access token (auto extracted from Authorization header).

  • db – Async database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid or user not found.

Returns:

User object.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Decode the email confirmation token and return the email.

Parameters:

token – JWT email confirmation token.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Returns:

Email extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hash the password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password – Plain text password.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify if a plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if passwords match, else False.

Return type:

bool

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send an email with a verification token using a predefined HTML template.

Args:

email (EmailStr): Recipient’s email address. username (str): Recipient’s username for personalization. host (str): Base URL of the application to build verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors: If there is an error connecting to the email server.
